question: Tirath Singh Rawat has been sworn in as the Chief Minister of which state?
explanation:
Tirath Singh Rawat has been sworn in as the new Chief Minister of Uttarakhand after his predecessor Trivendra Singh Rawat resigned.
He is a BJP MP from Garhwal constituency and was the party chief of the state from the year 2013 to 2015. He was the first education minister of the state.
